ProgramName: Master of Accountancy
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency. This can be met by submitting a minimum score of 83 on the TOEFL iBT, 6.5 on the IELTS, 115 on the Duolingo English Test, or 59 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE). The requirement may be waived for applicants who have earned a degree in the U.S. or are citizens of a country where English is the official language, among other criteria.
Concentration: Tax, Data Analytics and Financial Reporting
Description: The Belk College of Business Master of Accountancy (MACC) program is designed for both accounting and non-accounting majors to prepare students for rewarding careers in accounting. The MACC program has an outstanding record of placing graduates with public accounting firms, corporations, government agencies and not-for-profit organizations. In addition to a comprehensive curriculum that positions students for success on the CPA exam, the MACC program provides an invaluable competitive advantage: a network of outstanding students, a dedicated faculty of teacher-scholars, and a strong alumni base in Charlotte and beyond. In fact, many of our students accept job offers before they graduate.
Accredidation: The Belk College of Business is accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Master in Business Administration (MBA)
EnglishScore: International applicants are required to submit proof of English language proficiency. Acceptable tests and minimum scores are: an official TOEFL score of 83 (internet-based test) or 557 (paper-based test), an official IELTS score of 6.5, or an official Duolingo score of 115.
Requirements:
For admission to the Belk College of Business M.B.A. program, an applicant should have a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university. A satisfactory score on the GMAT or GRE is required unless a waiver is granted. Applicants also need two years of professional work experience and an acceptable score on the TOEFL or IELTS (if the native language is not English).

Application Requirements:

*   An Application for Graduate Admission
*   Official transcripts for all academic work completed after high school
*   A satisfactory score on the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or the Graduate Record Examinations (GRE) General Test. Test score waivers are available for some highly qualified applicants. For more information regarding waiver requirements, visit our website at mba.charlotte.edu.
*   Resume with a minimum of two years of professional, post-baccalaureate work experience
*   Statement of Purpose describing your reasons for pursuing a graduate business degree and your career goals
*   Three letters of recommendation
Fees: Estimated In-State Total Program Cost: $21,114, Estimated Out-of-State Total Program Cost: $38,829
Concentration: ['Applied Investment Management', 'Business Analytics', 'Commercial Real Estate', 'Crowdsourcing', 'Digital Marketing', 'Economics', 'Energy', 'Entrepreneurship and Corporate Venturing', 'Financial Institutions/Commercial Banking', 'Human Resources Management', 'Information and Technology Management', 'International Management', 'Marketing', 'Operations Management']
Description: The Belk College of Business Master of Business Administration (MBA) program is designed for working professionals from a wide variety of industries and academic backgrounds. The MBA program combines a strong foundation in business knowledge with opportunities for specialization. The nationally-ranked program is offered in a flexible format, allowing students to select the pace and format that best meets their needs. The program offers a core curriculum that provides a solid foundation in the functional areas of business and elective courses to develop expertise. All core courses emphasize business concepts through the case method and other forms of experiential learning, enabling students to apply the course material to real business problems. Elective courses in the MBA program are designed to offer a deeper level of expertise in a variety of business areas. In addition to a variety of broad elective courses, the MBA program offers 14 concentrations. These concentrations allow students to gain in-depth knowledge in a specific area of interest.
Accredidation: The Belk College of Business at UNC Charlotte is accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB), the premier accrediting agency for business schools worldwide. This means the Belk College has met the rigorous standards of quality for both its faculty and academic programs. Less than five percent of business schools in the world have earned this distinction.
ScholarshipAmount: Graduate assistantships may cover full-tuition and include a stipend.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Economics
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language are required to submit official scores on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) that are not more than two years old. The minimum TOEFL score for admission is 557 on the paper-based test or 83 on the internet-based test. The minimum IELTS score is 6.5. The English language proficiency requirement may be waived for applicants who have earned a post-secondary degree from a U.S. institution.
Requirements: In addition to the general requirements for admission to the Graduate School, the following are required for admission to the M.S. in Economics program: 1. A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university. 2. An overall undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0. 3. Successful completion of the following prerequisite coursework with a grade of B or better: Principles of Macroeconomics, Principles of Microeconomics, Intermediate Macroeconomics, Intermediate Microeconomics, Calculus I, and Statistics. 4. Unofficial transcripts are required with the application. Official transcripts will be required if you are offered admission. 5. A Statement of Purpose is required. 6. Three letters of recommendation are required. 7. GRE/GMAT scores are optional. 8. Resume is optional. 9. All international applicants are required to take the TOEFL and have their scores submitted if their native language is not English.
Description: The Master of Science in Economics is a quantitatively rigorous program that will equip you with the mathematical and statistical modeling skills needed for a career as an economist or analyst in the private or public sector, or to pursue a Ph.D. in economics or a related field. The program is designated as a science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) program, which allows international graduates on F-1 visas to work in the U.S. for up to three years after graduation under the Optional Practical Training (OPT) program. The curriculum provides a solid foundation in microeconomic theory, macroeconomic theory, and econometrics. Students choose between two concentrations: quantitative economics or quantitative finance. Our location in the heart of the second-largest financial center in the country provides graduates with a wide array of internship and career opportunities. UNC Charlotte is the only university in the Carolinas to offer a graduate degree in economics.
Accredidation: The Belk College of Business is accredited by AACSB International.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Management
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in the English language.
Requirements: A complete application for the Master of Science in Management includes: the online application and fee, unofficial transcripts from all institutions attended, a current resume, three letters of recommendation, a Statement of Purpose addressing specific prompts, and a video essay. Official GMAT or GRE scores are listed as a requirement, though waivers are available for qualified applicants. An interview may also be requested by the admissions committee. International applicants have additional requirements, including proof of English language proficiency.
Description: The Master of Science in Management (M.S. in Management) at UNC Charlotte’s Belk College of Business is a one-year, 30-credit hour graduate program designed for students with a non-business undergraduate degree and less than one year of professional work experience. Students develop a strong foundation of business knowledge with courses in all functional areas of business, including marketing, finance, accounting, business analytics, and more. Our program is taught by the same expert faculty who teach in our top-ranked MBA program. Team-based projects and professional development opportunities are incorporated into the curriculum to ensure students graduate with the skills needed to lead in a variety of industries. The M.S. in Management is a cohort-based program offering students the chance to connect with peers and build their professional network. The program is 11 months, full-time, starting in July and ending in May. The curriculum consists of 10 classes and a two-part professional development course. Students will also be required to participate in an offsite orientation prior to the start of classes. As a STEM-designated program, the M.S. in Management allows international students to extend their time in the U.S. to gain career experience.
Accredidation: The Belk College of Business is accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mathematical Finance
EnglishScore: Official TOEFL or IELTS scores for international applicants. This requirement is waived for applicants who have a degree from a U.S. university.
Department: Belk College of Business and College of Liberal Arts & Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Mathematical Finance program is designed to prepare students for careers in the quantitative analysis of financial markets and the management of risk. The interdisciplinary curriculum is delivered by faculty from three UNC Charlotte colleges – the Belk College of Business, the College of Computing and Informatics, and the College of Liberal Arts & Sciences – and leverages the University’s position as a leading research institution in one of America’s fastest-growing financial capitals. Our graduates are well-prepared for a variety of roles in investment banks, commercial banks, hedge funds, insurance companies, corporate treasuries, and regulatory agencies. The program is designated as a STEM program (CIP code 27.0305). As an academic partner with both the Global Association of Risk Professionals (GARP) and the Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst (CAIA) Association, we are able to offer a curriculum that is on the forefront of industry practices and developments in risk management and alternative investments.
CostPerCredit: NC Residents: $440.05/credit hour; Non-NC Residents: $1,173.05/credit hour

ProgramName: Master of Science in Real Estate
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency.
Description: The Master of Science in Real Estate (M.S. in Real Estate) is the only program of its kind in the Carolinas. Offered through the Belk College of Business and the Childress Klein Center for Real Estate (CKCRE), this flexible, 33-credit-hour program is designed to provide students with the skills necessary to succeed in a variety of real estate industry careers. The M.S. in Real Estate provides a broad overview of the real estate industry, with a focus on commercial real estate development and investment. Courses are offered on a part-time basis to accommodate both working professionals and full-time students. With a strong focus on finance and development, students who graduate from this program will be equipped for a wide variety of careers in the real-estate industry, including real estate development, lending, investment, and corporate real estate. The program also provides the foundation for students to work toward several professional certifications including the CCIM, ARGUS and LEED AP credentials.
Accredidation: The Belk College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, which represents the highest standard of achievement for business schools worldwide.
CostPerCredit: In-state: $458.50/credit hour (tuition only); Out-of-state: $1,225.50/credit hour (tuition only)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Data Science and Business Analytics
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in English by submitting official scores for either the TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or PTE academic that are no more than two years old.
Requirements: Applicants must meet the requirements for admission to the Graduate School. In addition, the following are required: A bachelor’s degree in a related discipline from a regionally accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher is expected. Students are expected to have a strong quantitative background including at least two semesters of calculus, a semester of statistics, and a background in computer programming. Standardized test scores (GRE/GMAT) are optional for all applicants. Unofficial transcripts from all institutions attended. Three letters of recommendation. Resume/CV (no more than two pages). A Statement of Purpose that addresses your motivations for pursuing this degree and your career goals.
Concentration: ['AI & Machine Learning', 'Bioinformatics', 'Business Analytics', 'Cybersecurity Analytics', 'Data Visualization & High-Performance Computing', 'Financial Technology (FinTech)', 'Health Informatics']
Description: The Master of Science in Data Science and Business Analytics (DSBA) is an interdisciplinary degree program offered by the College of Computing and Informatics, the Belk College of Business, the College of Health and Human Services, and the Department of Mathematics and Statistics in the College of Liberal Arts & Sciences. The DSBA master’s program is a professional program that provides students with a deep understanding of the analytical and technical skills needed to analyze large datasets and drive decision-making in any organization. The DSBA program is a unique blend of data science, business analytics, and big data management. Our interdisciplinary approach ensures students are well-prepared to tackle complex challenges in the ever-evolving world of data. The DSBA program prepares students for careers in a variety of fields, including data science, business analytics, data engineering, and data-driven decision-making. Students have the opportunity to participate in research, internships, and other experiential learning opportunities to enhance their skills and knowledge.

ProgramName: PhD in Computing and Information Systems
EnglishScore: International applicants who are not citizens of a country where English is the official language must submit an official score report from TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, PTE, or ELS. Scores must not be more than two years old.
Concentration: Bioinformatics and Genomics, Computer Science, Software and Information Systems
Description: The Ph.D. in Computing and Information Systems (CIS) is an interdisciplinary program, offered by the Department of Computer Science, the Department of Software and Information Systems, and the Department of Bioinformatics and Genomics. Students in the program receive a broad background in the various areas of computing and information systems and conduct in-depth research in a specific area of interest. The program aims to train students to be first-class researchers and prepare them for careers in research or academia.
ScholarshipAmount: Minimum $17,000 stipend for doctoral assistants, plus tuition and health insurance support.

ProgramName: PhD in Organizational Science
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in the English language by submitting official test scores from TOEFL (minimum 83 iBT or 557 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo (minimum 115), or PTE Academic (minimum 59), or by presenting a Certificate of Completion of Level 112 from an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: An online application submitted through the Graduate School's application portal. A statement of purpose that outlines your motivation for pursuing a Ph.D. in Organizational Science, your research interests and career goals, and how you see yourself fitting with the program. A resume outlining your educational and work history. Unofficial transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Official GRE scores (the UNC Charlotte school code is 5105). Three letters of recommendation. A non-refundable application fee.
Department: Belk College of Business and College of Liberal Arts & Sciences
Fees: NC Resident: $7,677/Year; Non-Resident: $22,311/Year (Note: Admitted students receive tuition support as part of their funding package)
Description: The Organizational Science Ph.D. Program at UNC Charlotte is an interdisciplinary program that grants a Ph.D. degree in Organizational Science. Our program provides doctoral-level training to students from a variety of academic backgrounds. By bringing together faculty from a number of different social science disciplines, we are able to offer a more diverse curriculum and a richer intellectual experience than is typically found in a traditional, departmental-based Ph.D. program. Our program is broadly focused on the application of social science theory and methods to the study of a wide variety of substantive topics related to organizations and their members. Our core faculty are nationally-recognized scholars in a number of fields including management, psychology, sociology, and communication studies. This diversity is a major asset and gives our program a distinct identity that makes it an attractive choice for students who do not fit neatly into a single discipline. We are a STEM-designated degree program (CIP Code 30.9999 – Multi-/Interdisciplinary Studies, Other). All students are guaranteed funding for four years with the possibility of a fifth year of funding.
ScholarshipAmount: All admitted students receive a funding package that includes a $22,500 per year stipend, tuition support, and health insurance.

ProgramName: PhD in Public Policy
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in the English language.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must hold a master’s degree from an accredited U.S. university or its equivalent from a foreign institution. The following materials must be submitted as part of your application: An online application for graduate admission; A non-refundable application fee; Official transcripts from ALL post-secondary institutions attended; Official Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores (The UNC Charlotte code is 5105); A statement of purpose; A writing sample; Three letters of recommendation; A resume or curriculum vitae; For international students, official TOEFL or IELTS scores may be required.
Concentration: public health, social policy, education, environmental policy, and urban and regional policy
Description: The Public Policy Ph.D. program at UNC Charlotte is an interdisciplinary program that draws on the assets of seven departments and three colleges at the university, including the College of Liberal Arts & Sciences, the Belk College of Business, and the College of Health and Human Services. The curriculum is policy-focused and research-oriented, with students taking courses in public policy, research methods, and a specialized concentration. Students can choose a concentration in a number of substantive policy areas, including but not limited to public health, social policy, education, environmental policy, and urban and regional policy. The program prepares graduates for careers in academia and in the public, private, and non-profit sectors. Located in North Carolina's major urban region, UNC Charlotte is an excellent place to study urban and regional policy issues. The Public Policy Program has a strong relationship with the City of Charlotte, Mecklenburg County, and many nonprofit organizations in the area. Graduates from the program are prepared to contribute to policy analysis and policy making in a variety of settings.
ScholarshipAmount: Stipend of $22,000 for the academic year

ProgramName: PhD in Business Administration (Finance)
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language are required to demonstrate proficiency by submitting a satisfactory score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or the Duolingo English Test. The minimum TOEFL score is 83 (iBT) or 557 (PBT), the minimum IELTS score is 6.5, and the minimum Duolingo score is 115.
Description: The Ph.D. in Business Administration program offers a specialization in finance. The program provides a stimulating learning environment for a small and highly select group of students. We equip our students with the theoretical, analytical and research skills needed for a successful career in academic research and teaching. Our faculty actively researches a broad range of topics and regularly publishes in top-tier journals. We work closely with our doctoral students on research projects throughout the program. Students benefit from the low student-to-faculty ratio and individualized attention.
Accredidation: The Belk College of Business at UNC Charlotte is accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. AACSB International is the premier accrediting agency for bachelor's, master's and doctoral degree programs in business administration and accounting.
ScholarshipAmount: $22,000 per year stipend

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Teaching - Elementary Education (K-6)
EnglishScore: International applicants are required to submit proof of English language proficiency. Minimum scores are TOEFL 83 (iBT) or 557 (paper-based), IELTS 6.5, or Duolingo English Test 115. Completion of ELS Language Centers' English for Academic Purposes Level 112 is also accepted. The requirement may be waived for applicants who have earned a post-secondary degree from a U.S. institution or from a predetermined country where English is the official language.
Fees: NC Resident: $3,396.83/Semester or $6,793.66/Year. Non-NC Resident: $10,805.69/Semester or $21,611.38/Year.
Description: The Master of Arts in Teaching (M.A.T.) in Elementary Education is a 39-credit hour graduate program designed for students who have an undergraduate degree in a field other than education and who want to become licensed to teach in elementary schools (Kindergarten through grade 6). Coursework in the program is offered completely online. The program is specifically intended for individuals who want to be prepared to teach in a diverse 21st century classroom. The program focuses on teaching linguistically and culturally diverse students and ensuring that teacher candidates are well prepared in all content areas, particularly in literacy and mathematics instruction. The M.A.T. program focuses on developing deep pedagogical content knowledge across the elementary curriculum. The M.A.T. program has two tracks: a full-time, 15-month program that includes a yearlong student teaching internship; or a part-time option where candidates work as a lateral entry teacher and take two courses a semester. Both tracks lead to a master’s degree and an ‘A’ level North Carolina teaching license.
Accredidation: The Cato College of Education at UNC Charlotte is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
CostPerCredit: NC Resident: $213.37 per credit hour (tuition only). Non-NC Resident: $919.12 per credit hour (tuition only).
CollegeApplicationFee: NC Resident: $3,396.83/Semester or $6,793.66/Year. Non-NC Resident: $10,805.69/Semester or $21,611.38/Year.
ScholarshipAmount: Minimum stipend for Master's Graduate Assistantships is $14,000 for the academic year.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Teaching - Middle and Secondary Education (6-12)
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. The university accepts TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, and PTE Academic scores, or completion of the ELS program.
Requirements: All students must meet the general requirements for admission of the Graduate School. In addition, applicants for the M.A.T. must: 1. Hold a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university. 2. Have an undergraduate cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. 3. Submit a Statement of Purpose that describes in 500-1000 words: (a) your reasons for wanting to enter the teaching profession, particularly in your chosen licensure area, and in middle or high school; (b) your experiences and/or qualities that will make you an effective teacher; and (c) your commitment to working with a diverse student population. 4. Submit three appropriate letters of recommendation from individuals who can evaluate your potential for graduate study and for becoming a teacher. 5. Submit a resume. 6. Participate in an interview with program faculty. 7. International students must demonstrate proficiency with the English language as required by the Graduate School.
Fees: NC Resident: $4,201.25/semester (full-time, 9+ credits); Non-NC Resident: $11,717.25/semester (full-time, 9+ credits)
Concentration: English Language Arts; Mathematics; Science; Social Studies
Description: The Master of Arts in Teaching (M.A.T.) in Middle Grades Education is for individuals who have an undergraduate degree in a field other than education and who want to become a middle school teacher in one of the following areas: English Language Arts; Mathematics; Science; Social Studies. This program is a 33-hour initial licensure program designed to be completed in four semesters. It combines coursework with extensive field-based experiences to prepare graduates for a successful career in a middle school classroom and to be teacher leaders. The M.A.T. program is approved by the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction. It includes a core of professional education studies that provide a strong foundation in teaching and learning as well as content-specific pedagogy courses that focus on the unique challenges of teaching in particular subject areas.
Accredidation: The M.A.T. program is approved by the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction. The Cato College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
CostPerCredit: NC Resident: $466.75/credit hour; Non-NC Resident: $1,301.75/credit hour

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Teaching - Foreign Language Education (K-12)
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. This can be met by submitting an acceptable score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a score of 557 on the paper-based test or 83 on the internet-based test, the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with an overall band score of 6.5, or Duolingo with a score of 115. Completion of Level 112 of the ELS Language Centers curriculum is also accepted.
Requirements:
An undergraduate degree from a regionally-accredited college or university.
An undergraduate GPA of 2.75 or higher from a regionally-accredited college or university. Applicants with a GPA between 2.50 and 2.74 may be considered for provisional admission.
At least 24 semester hours of coursework in the language of licensure with a GPA of 2.75 or higher from a regionally-accredited college or university.
A passing score on the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators tests (Reading, Writing, and Mathematics). Applicants may be exempt from the Praxis Core requirement by submitting qualifying scores on the SAT or ACT.
A Statement of Purpose explaining the applicant’s interest in the program and reasons for wanting to become a teacher.
Three letters of recommendation.
A successful interview with program faculty may be required.
Successful completion of the Oral Proficiency Interview (OPI) with a rating of “Advanced Low” or higher.
For international applicants, an official score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of at least 557 on the paper-based test or 83 on the internet-based test (iBT), or an overall band score of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS).
Acceptable background check, as required by the school districts in the UNC Charlotte partnership region.
Description: The Graduate Certificate and M.A.T. Programs in Foreign Language Education lead to an initial North Carolina teaching license in French, German, Spanish, or Japanese for grades K-12. The Graduate Certificate is an 18- to 21-credit hour program for applicants who already hold a bachelor’s degree in a foreign language (or its equivalent). The Master of Arts in Teaching (M.A.T.) is a 33- to 36-credit hour program for individuals seeking a master’s degree and an initial teaching license. Students in the M.A.T. take the same courses as students in the Graduate Certificate, plus 12-15 hours of additional coursework leading to the master’s degree. Students in our programs learn from expert faculty in language pedagogy and have extensive opportunities to work with experienced teachers in public school classrooms. In addition to online and on-campus coursework, all students in our programs complete a one-semester (full-time) student teaching internship as a capstone experience. This combination of rigorous coursework and practical experience ensures that our graduates are well-prepared to be effective world language teachers in K-12 schools.
Accredidation: Our programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction (NCDPI).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Teaching - Special Education (K-12)
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take one of the following English language proficiency tests and submit official scores: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo English Test. English proficiency scores must be less than two years old. The minimum acceptable scores are: 83 on the iBT (Internet-based Test) or 557 on the PBT (Paper-based Test); 6.5 on the IELTS; or 115 on the Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: All applicants for graduate programs at UNC Charlotte must meet the general requirements of the Graduate School. For the M.A.T. in Special Education, the following are required: A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university. A GPA of 3.0 is expected. Transcripts of all academic work. Three letters of recommendation. A Statement of Purpose explaining the applicant’s interest in special education and career goals. A resume. Satisfactory scores on either the GRE, MAT, or state-approved teacher licensure basic skills exam (e.g., Praxis Core). This requirement is waived for applicants with a 3.0 GPA or higher (on a 4.0 scale) in their undergraduate degree or for applicants who hold a master’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university. Applicants may submit test scores if they believe it will strengthen their application.
Description: The Master of Arts in Teaching (M.A.T.) in Special Education with a concentration in either General Curriculum or Adapted Curriculum is designed for individuals who hold a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university in a field outside of education and who wish to obtain a master’s degree and an initial North Carolina teaching license to teach students with disabilities. It is offered in a 100% online format to offer flexibility to our students. Candidates are required to hold a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. This 33-hour online program offers initial North Carolina licensure and a master’s degree to teach students with disabilities at the elementary, middle, or high school levels. Candidates learn to teach students with a wide range of learning needs and abilities. Graduates of the program are able to provide specialized instruction in all academic content areas to students with mild to moderate disabilities.
Accredidation: The special education programs at UNC Charlotte are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Teaching - Teaching English as a Second Language (K-12)
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency. The University recognizes scores from TOEFL, IELTS, and Duolingo.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the M.A.T. in TESL, applicants must meet the general requirements for graduate admission to UNC Charlotte. These include: A bachelor’s degree (or its equivalent) from a regionally accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher. A completed online application through the Graduate School’s website. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. A statement of purpose. Three letters of recommendation. International applicants must also demonstrate English proficiency.
Concentration: Teaching English as a Second Language (K-12)
Description: The Master of Arts in Teaching (M.A.T.) program provides a course of study for individuals who have a bachelor’s degree in a field other than education and who are seeking an initial North Carolina teaching license at the master’s degree level. Individuals who already hold a teaching license are not eligible for admission to this program. The program prepares teachers as leaders for a diverse, technological, and global society. The M.A.T. offers a fully online, part-time, program of study leading to a North Carolina Standard Professional I license in a number of K-12 subject areas. Some concentrations also offer a full-time option. The program builds on the content knowledge that students have gained in their undergraduate degree as they prepare for a career in teaching. The program’s innovative curriculum links theory and practice through courses that are grounded in the authentic work of teaching in a diverse society.
Accredidation: The Cato College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The M.A.T. program is approved by the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction (NCDPI).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Teaching - Early Childhood Education (Birth-Kindergarten)
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. The following are the minimum scores required for admission to a graduate program: TOEFL: 83 on the internet-based test or 557 on the paper-based test; IELTS: 6.5 Overall band score; Duolingo English Test: 115; PTE Academic: 59.
Requirements:
A four-year undergraduate degree in any field (except teacher education) from a regionally accredited college or university.
A GPA of 3.0 or higher in an undergraduate degree is preferred. GPA of 2.75 required.
Graduate Record Exam (GRE) or Miller Analogies Test (MAT) scores are no longer required for admission to this program.
Official transcripts from all universities/colleges attended.
Three letters of recommendation from professional sources (e.g., professor, supervisor) using the online letter of recommendation form. At least one must be from a college or university instructor.
A statement of purpose of approximately 300-500 words describing your experiences with children and your reasons for pursuing a career in teaching.
A resume listing work experience and education.
Interview with program faculty.
TOEFL or IELTS scores for international applicants.
Fees: In-State: $3,905.75/semester; Out-of-State: $11,381.75/semester (based on 2023-2024 full-time rates for 9+ credit hours)
Description: The Master of Arts in Teaching (M.A.T.) in Early Childhood Education (Birth-Kindergarten) is designed for individuals who have a bachelor’s degree in a field other than teacher education and want to become licensed to teach young children from birth through kindergarten. Students complete course work focused on early childhood development and education, inclusive practices, working with families and diverse communities, and assessment. The M.A.T. also requires field experiences and an internship to provide students with hands-on practice in a variety of settings with diverse children and families.
Accredidation: The Cato College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The M.A.T. in Early Childhood Education program is approved by the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction.

- Official transcripts of all academic work attempted since high school.
- A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university.
- A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale in the undergraduate degree is required.
- Three letters of recommendation, submitted through the online application, from individuals who can speak to the applicant’s academic and/or professional potential.

Description: The M.Ed. in Reading Education is a 33-hour graduate degree program that leads to advanced licensure as a K-12 Reading Specialist in North Carolina public schools. The program is fully online and can be completed by a full-time student (9 hours per semester) in four semesters. Part-time options are also available. The program meets the standards of the International Literacy Association (ILA) and the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction (NCDPI). The M.Ed. in Reading Education at UNC Charlotte is one of the highest ranked programs in the country according to U.S. News & World Report. The fully online M.Ed. program is practitioner-oriented. Our graduates are prepared to serve as literacy leaders in a variety of roles (e.g., literacy coach, reading specialist, interventionist, classroom teacher). The coursework, which is aligned with the latest research in the science of reading, focuses on evidence-based literacy instruction for all students. Courses in the M.Ed. program incorporate relevant, authentic, and meaningful assignments that students can apply directly in their own schools and classrooms.
Accredidation: The program meets the standards of the International Literacy Association (ILA) and the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction (NCDPI).

Description: The M.Ed. in Special Education is a 33-credit hour program that prepares graduate students to serve children and youth with disabilities. The M.Ed. in Special Education has two concentrations: General Curriculum and Adapted Curriculum. The program meets the beginning and advanced teacher competencies for special educators established by the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction (NCDPI) and the Council for Exceptional Children (CEC). The concentration in General Curriculum is designed for individuals who wish to work with students with mild disabilities (i.e., learning disabilities, mild intellectual disabilities, emotional/behavioral disabilities and other health impairments) who are being taught in the general education curriculum. A major focus of the General Curriculum concentration is providing students with skills in collaboration with other school professionals to meet the needs of students with disabilities in inclusive settings. Graduates are prepared for a variety of professional roles, including serving as a classroom teacher in a resource or inclusive setting, or as a consultant or inclusion specialist.
Accredidation: The Cato College of Education at UNC Charlotte is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). This accreditation covers initial teacher preparation programs and advanced educator preparation programs.

A strong emphasis is placed on the use of evidence-based practices to improve the academic, social, behavioral, and communication outcomes for students with disabilities. Coursework aligns with the advanced competencies for special educators as defined by the Council for Exceptional Children (CEC) and the N.C. Department of Public Instruction. Upon completion of coursework, candidates can apply for the advanced M-level teaching license from the state of N.C. in their respective area of specialization (i.e., Adapted Curriculum or General Curriculum).

Two concentrations are available that lead to a master's degree in Child and Family Studies: (1) an advanced licensure concentration in Birth-Kindergarten (B-K) for teachers who already hold an initial B-K license and (2) a concentration for professionals in child and family services who do not seek a teaching license. This program of study is designed for experienced B-K professionals who hold (or are eligible to hold) a North Carolina “A” license and wish to pursue a graduate degree and are eligible for an “M” license. The M.Ed. program emphasizes the development of leadership skills and advocacy for young children and families.

Description: The Master of Arts in Addiction Counseling is a 60-credit-hour program designed to meet the growing need for skilled addiction counseling professionals. Our rigorous academic curriculum and extensive clinical training prepares students to become Licensed Clinical Addiction Specialists (LCAS) and Licensed Clinical Mental Health Counselors (LCMHC) in North Carolina. Students are also eligible for national certifications, including Master Addictions Counselor (MAC). This degree provides students with specialized knowledge in the prevention, assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of substance use disorders. Students complete a 900-hour clinical internship, which provides a rich, hands-on opportunity to work with and learn from experienced professionals in the community. Graduates of our program are highly sought after by employers, and are prepared for a variety of leadership roles in the field of addiction.

Description: The Master of Arts in English Education at UNC Charlotte is an advanced degree for experienced teachers. The program is specifically designed to meet the needs of working teachers with courses offered in the evenings during the school year and in the summer. Courses are taught by English Education faculty who all have secondary school teaching experience, as well as faculty in the English Department specializing in literature, rhetoric and composition, creative writing, and linguistics. The program is based on the premise that accomplished teachers of English Language Arts need to integrate their advanced disciplinary knowledge in English with an extended range of effective pedagogical practices. With its dual focus on content and pedagogy, the program engages teachers in a rich dialogue about the theory and practice of teaching English at the secondary level. Candidates in the program can earn either the M.A. in English Education or the M.A. in English Education with a Graduate Certificate in Teaching English as a Second Language. Successful completion of the program fulfills the requirements for the North Carolina “M” level licensure in English Language Arts, Grades 9-12 (with an option to add K-12 ESL licensure). The program also offers an option for initial teacher licensure for individuals seeking to make a career change to teaching.

Transcripts of all prior academic work must be submitted.
Three letters of recommendation are required.
The GRE is not required for admission to this certificate program.
Fees: $5,214 (in-state); $15,375 (out-of-state) for the entire program (12 credit hours).
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Precision Metrology provides students with training in the fundamentals and applications of precision metrology using state-of-the-art equipment. This certificate is intended for students and practicing engineers who require a more in-depth knowledge of precision metrology to advance their careers and/or research activities. This certificate program focuses on the methods for measurement of size, form, and surface finish of manufactured components. The program includes hands-on experience in a fully equipped laboratory using a variety of metrology instruments such as coordinate measuring machines, form measuring instruments, surface finish profilometers, and interferometers.

ProgramName: Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science - Bioengineering
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. Accepted methods include TOEFL with a score of 557 on the paper-based test or 83 on the iBT test, IELTS with a score of 6.5, Duolingo with a score of 115, Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a score of 59, or a Certificate of Completion of Level 112 of the ELS Language Centers Intensive Program.
Requirements: A bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, or a related field, from a regionally accredited college or university. An overall GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale (or its equivalent) is required for admission to the M.S. program. Transcripts from all institutions attended are required. Three letters of recommendation are required. A Statement of Purpose is required. The GRE is optional for all MSME applicants. International applicants must provide a satisfactory score on the TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo English Test.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (M.S.M.E.) degree program in The William States Lee College of Engineering at UNC Charlotte is a research-focused graduate program for students with an interest in extending their knowledge of the fundamentals of mechanical engineering and applying it to solving complex, modern problems. Students in the program develop critical thinking and research skills as they work to solve problems through projects and a thesis or dissertation in a range of areas in the field. The M.S.M.E. degree has both a thesis and non-thesis option. Concentrations include: automotive engineering, bioengineering, computational mechanics, dynamics and controls, manufacturing and metrology, materials science, motorsports engineering, and thermal-fluids sciences.
ScholarshipAmount: Minimum assistantship stipend: $12,000 for 9-month full-time appointment. Dean's Distinguished Graduate Fellowship: $18,000 for Master’s students.

ProgramName: Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science - Computational Mechanics and Materials
EnglishScore: For international applicants whose native language is not English, a minimum score of 557 on the paper-based or 83 on the internet-based Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), or a minimum score of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) is required.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The concentration in Computational Mechanics and Materials provides a master’s degree focused on state-of-the-art computational methods and materials modeling. Students can design their plan of study in two tracks: computational mechanics of materials or materials science and engineering. Computational mechanics students develop skills for numerically solving problems in solid mechanics, fluid mechanics, material science, biomechanics, and acoustics. They can select from graduate courses in continuum mechanics, finite element analysis, computational fluid dynamics, multiphysics modeling, high-performance computing, and multiscale modeling. Materials science and engineering students focus on the fundamentals of materials’ structure-property-processing-performance relationships. They can select from graduate courses in mechanical behavior of materials, thermodynamics of materials, materials characterization, composites, advanced manufacturing, and nanomaterials. Both tracks combine a strong background in theory with hands-on experience in modeling and characterization software packages used in research and industry.
ScholarshipAmount: $1,000 (Gage Undergraduate/Graduate Scholarship)

ProgramName: Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science - Dynamics and Controls
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. This may be accomplished by submitting an acceptable score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo.
Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the Graduate School, the following are required for admission to the Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering program:

An undergraduate degree in mechanical engineering or a closely related field. Students with other engineering degrees may be required to complete specific undergraduate coursework before full admission into the program. Coursework may be specified at the time of admission.
An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or better. Applicants with an undergraduate GPA between 2.5 and 3.0 will be considered for provisional admission.
GRE is not required.
International students from non-English speaking countries must meet the minimum university English proficiency requirements. Specific score requirements can be found on the Graduate School’s website here.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (M.S.M.E.) program provides students with an opportunity to pursue advanced studies in a variety of specialty areas within mechanical engineering. The graduate program provides a balance between advanced theory and practical knowledge in the areas of computational mechanics and materials, dynamics and controls, manufacturing and metrology, motorsports engineering, thermal fluids science, and bioengineering. Both thesis and non-thesis options are available in the M.S.M.E. degree program. Graduate certificates are also offered in several specialty areas. For more details on the program, please visit the Department of Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science website.

ProgramName: Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science - Manufacturing and Metrology
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT (83), IELTS (6.5), or Duolingo (115).
Requirements:
Applicants must meet the general requirements for admission to a graduate degree program as specified by the Graduate School. Admission to the M.S.M.E. program is competitive. Meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission. The Department’s Graduate Admissions Committee considers all aspects of an application in its totality to make an admission decision. Minimum requirements for admission to the M.S.M.E. program include:

An earned baccalaureate degree in Mechanical Engineering, or in a related field such as another engineering discipline, physics, or mathematics, from an accredited college or university.
An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or better (on a 4.0 scale). Applicants with a lower GPA may be considered for provisional admission based on other factors.
The GRE is waived for applicants with a baccalaureate degree from an ABET-accredited program in the U.S. with a GPA of 3.0 or greater. The GRE is also waived for applicants with a Master’s or Doctoral degree from a U.S. institution.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (M.S.M.E.) degree program is designed to provide students with an opportunity to pursue a graduate-level education which will equip them with a unique set of advanced skills that are vital to research, high-tech industry, and other professional careers. Our program’s comprehensive curriculum blends instruction with hands-on labs and state-of-the-art computational facilities. The M.S.M.E. program offers a choice of two graduation paths. A Thesis option, recommended for research-oriented students who may wish to continue towards a Ph.D. degree. The Non-Thesis option is recommended for students who wish to focus on a particular application area or who have full-time jobs. In addition to a general M.S.M.E. degree, students can choose to concentrate in one of several high demand specialization areas, such as motorsports engineering, precision engineering, energy engineering, computational mechanics, manufacturing, or biomedical engineering.

ProgramName: Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science - Motorsports Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language are required to submit official scores for an English language proficiency test. Scores must be less than two years old. TOEFL: 557 (paper-based) or 83 (Internet-based). IELTS: 6.5. Duolingo English Test: 115. Pearson Test of English (PTE): 59.
Requirements: An undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field is required with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. For applicants with a degree in another field, completion of a set of prerequisite courses may be required before admission. Prospective students who do not have an undergraduate GPA of 3.0 may be considered for provisional admission if they have at least three years of professional experience in an engineering field or have an exceptional GRE score (V>150, Q>155, A>3.0). The GRE is not required for applicants with a bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering from an ABET-accredited program in the U.S. with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. The GRE is also not required for graduates with an engineering degree from UNC Charlotte. The GRE is required for all other applicants and may not be waived.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (M.S.M.E.) degree program at UNC Charlotte builds on the skills of undergraduate engineering, science and technology education with an advanced engineering curriculum. The program provides the education necessary to practice as a professional mechanical engineer in a variety of industries. The program offers thesis and non-thesis options. The M.S.M.E. degree program offers three concentrations: a general Mechanical Engineering concentration that can be customized to the student’s interests, a concentration in Motorsports Engineering, and a concentration in Metrology. The department also offers graduate certificates in Motorsports Engineering and other specialty areas, which can be completed as a stand-alone program or in conjunction with the M.S.M.E. program. The Motorsports Engineering concentration is ideal for students who wish to pursue a career in the motorsports industry. The curriculum focuses on the design, analysis, and optimization of racecars and racecar components.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $18,000 for master's students (e.g., Dean's Distinguished Graduate Fellowship)

ProgramName: Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science - Thermal Sciences and Fluid Mechanics
EnglishScore: For international students, an official TOEFL or IELTS score is required. A minimum total score of 83 on the iBT (with minimum scores of 20 on speaking, 20 on writing, 20 on reading, and 21 on listening) or a 6.5 overall on the IELTS is required.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (M.S.M.E.) program is a key part of graduate studies in the William States Lee College of Engineering, with over 100 students currently enrolled. A number of options are available to the students seeking a master's degree in mechanical engineering and engineering science. A thesis option and a non-thesis option are available. The M.S.M.E. degree requires 30 credit-hours of graduate work. The Mechanical Engineering program also offers an early-entry program for our undergraduate students. A wide variety of fellowships and assistantships is available to qualified students. Our faculty are active in a number of research areas and students often perform research on topics related to energy, manufacturing, metrology, mechanics, materials, and motorsports.
CostPerCredit: NC Resident: $243.06/credit hour (tuition only); Non-NC Resident: $1,034.83/credit hour (tuition only)

ProgramName: PhD in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science
EnglishScore: TOEFL/IELTS scores are required for international applicants unless they have earned a degree from a U.S. institution. The minimum score requirements are set by the Graduate School. The University accepts a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 83, a minimum IELTS score of 6.5, a minimum Duolingo score of 115, a minimum PTE score of 59, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: A bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or a closely-related discipline from a regionally accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale is recommended. Students with a GPA between 3.0 and 3.5 will be considered. For applicants with a master’s degree, a GPA of 3.5 or higher is recommended. All applicants must submit GRE scores. International applicants must also submit an English proficiency exam score (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo). A Statement of Purpose, a Resume/CV, and three letters of recommendation are also required for the application.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy degree in Mechanical Engineering provides students an opportunity to contribute to the body of knowledge in their chosen area of research. Students develop an individualized plan of study to acquire specific knowledge needed for their research. All Ph.D. students work closely with a faculty advisor throughout their program, culminating in the completion and defense of a doctoral dissertation. The Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering is a broad-based degree without formal concentrations. However, students will develop a specialty in one of the research areas of the Department.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in African, African American, and Diaspora Studies
Department: College of Humanities & Earth and Social Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in African, African American, and Diaspora Studies (AAADS) is an interdisciplinary program designed to provide students with an understanding of the experiences, cultures, and contributions of African and African American peoples throughout the world. The program is committed to a critical examination of historical and contemporary issues relevant to people of African descent, including their social, political, economic, and cultural developments. Students in the AAADS program will develop critical thinking skills, research abilities, and a nuanced understanding of race, ethnicity, gender, and class. The curriculum emphasizes a global perspective, exploring the connections between Africa, the Caribbean, North America, and other parts of the African Diaspora. Graduates will be prepared for a variety of careers in fields such as education, public policy, social justice, community development, international relations, and cultural institutions, as well as for further graduate study in related disciplines.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in American Studies
Department: College of Humanities & Earth and Social Sciences
Description: American Studies is an interdisciplinary program that draws on the expertise of a variety of departments and colleges across the UNC Charlotte campus to study the cultures and societies of the United States, broadly conceived. It features two core courses: an introduction to the interdisciplinary study of American cultures, and a capstone research seminar for seniors. Students complete a sequence of elective courses from at least three different departments, choosing from a wide array of options in fields such as history, literature, art, music, political science, religious studies, sociology, and women’s and gender studies. The program is flexible, allowing students to tailor their studies to their individual interests. American Studies trains students to think critically and analytically about a wide range of subjects, to formulate research questions, and to develop compelling arguments based on evidence. Students who major in American Studies acquire a broad knowledge of U.S. cultures and societies and develop strong skills in critical thinking, research, writing, and oral communication, preparing them for a variety of careers in fields such as education, law, journalism, government, public history, and museum work, or for graduate study.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in American Studies – American Indian and Indigenous Studies Concentration
Requirements: First-year students are required to submit an application, application fee, and an official high school transcript. Submission of SAT or ACT scores is optional for first-year applicants through Fall 2024. An essay and a list of your activities are included in the application and are strongly recommended. The writing sections of the SAT and ACT are not required.
Department: College of Humanities & Earth and Social Sciences
Concentration: American Indian and Indigenous Studies Concentration
Description: American Studies is an interdisciplinary program that examines the history, societies, and cultures of the United States and the Americas. The program provides students with a broad humanistic and social scientific education while allowing them to develop expertise in a specific concentration area. American Studies coursework challenges students to critically analyze cultural production, social institutions, political movements, and historical narratives from multiple perspectives. It emphasizes critical thinking, research, and communication skills applicable to a wide range of career fields including law, public policy, teaching, business, journalism, museum work, and archival studies. Graduates are well-prepared for professional careers and for further study in a variety of graduate and professional programs.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Anthropology
Requirements: Students can declare a major in Anthropology after completing ANTH 1101 with a grade of C or above.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Anthropology is designed to provide students with a broad and comprehensive understanding of the diverse aspects of human experience across time and space. Anthropology is a holistic discipline that encompasses the study of human biology, culture, language, and archaeology. The program emphasizes critical thinking, research methods, and ethical engagement with diverse populations and cultural practices. Students will develop skills in data collection, analysis, and interpretation, preparing them for a variety of careers in fields such as cultural resource management, international development, public health, education, and museum studies, as well as for graduate studies in anthropology or related disciplines. The curriculum offers a solid foundation in the subfields of anthropology and allows students to tailor their studies through electives and, optionally, a concentration in Applied Anthropology.
ScholarshipType: Merit-based scholarships, grants, loans, student employment

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Archaeology
Description: Archaeology is the study of the human past through its material remains. Archaeologists investigate all aspects of human history, from the emergence of our species to the historic periods of the modern world. The study of archaeology combines the social sciences, humanities, and natural sciences through an interdisciplinary approach to research. This interdisciplinary approach gives students both breadth and depth in their understanding of the various sub-fields of anthropology and the related sciences. The Archaeology B.A. provides students with a broad and deep understanding of the human past, a strong training in archaeological field methods and theory, and a critical perspective on the interpretation of material culture. Students graduating with a B.A. in Archaeology will have the skills necessary for continued graduate study in archaeology or for careers in cultural resource management, museums, education, or other fields.
CostPerCredit: NC Resident: $301.50/Credit Hour; Non-NC Resident: $919.04/Credit Hour

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Art History
Requirements: Students may declare a major in Art History at any time. The requirements to declare a major include a minimum GPA of 2.0.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Art History prepares students for careers in museums, galleries, cultural institutions, and graduate study in art history. Students develop skills in visual analysis, critical thinking, research, and writing through the study of global art and architectural traditions.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Asian Studies
Department: College of Humanities & Earth and Social Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Global Studies is an interdisciplinary program designed for students interested in understanding global processes, problems, and interconnections. The major emphasizes critical thinking about global issues from a variety of perspectives—political, economic, historical, social, and cultural. Students develop knowledge about world regions, acquire foreign language proficiency, and gain cross-cultural understanding. The major offers students a choice of six concentrations that align with career interests and/or graduate studies. The program prepares students for a wide variety of careers in government, non-governmental organizations, business, international education, and other fields that require global literacy.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Asian Studies – Arab Cultures Concentration
Requirements: First-year admission to UNC Charlotte is competitive. All applications receive a holistic review which takes multiple factors into consideration for an admission decision. This includes your academic performance in high school, standardized test scores (if you choose to submit them), and your required essay. The following items are required to complete your application: Online Application and Fee, Official High School Transcript, Official SAT or ACT Scores (Note: UNC Charlotte is test-optional), and an Essay. A recommendation is optional but strongly recommended.
Description: The Asian Studies program provides an interdisciplinary curriculum that enables students to gain an understanding of the region's diverse cultures, societies, and languages. Asian Studies majors develop the critical thinking, research, and communication skills necessary for success in a globalized world. The curriculum allows students to choose one of four concentrations: Arab Cultures, East Asia, South Asia, or Southeast Asia. Students are strongly encouraged to study abroad in an Asian country.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Behavioral Sciences
Bachelor of Arts in Chemistry
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Chemistry degree program is designed for students seeking a broad education in chemistry with greater flexibility to pursue other academic interests in allied fields or in other non-science fields. The B.A. curriculum includes introductory courses in analytical, inorganic, organic, and physical chemistry, along with biochemistry. Additional upper-level courses are chosen from the several subdisciplines in chemistry. The B.A. degree also prepares students for chemistry-related careers in business, education, government, and technical sales, as well as for various graduate and professional programs. The B.A. degree provides a solid foundation for further study in chemistry, health-related fields, or other disciplines.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Classics – Classical Archaeology
Description: The study of Classics offers an engaging exploration of the roots of Western Civilization while cultivating analytical and communication skills prized by employers and graduate programs. Through a wide range of courses, students explore the literature, history, art, and philosophy of Greece and Rome and their interactions with the ancient Near East and other cultures. Students may choose from three concentrations: Ancient Greek and Latin, Classical Archaeology, and Classical Civilization. Whichever concentration they pursue, students learn to apply critical thinking and interpretive skills to human experience, to conduct research, to think about ethical questions, and to communicate effectively. The Bachelor of Arts in Classics provides excellent preparation for careers in such fields as law, medicine, teaching, journalism, business, public service, and library or museum work. It also prepares students for graduate study in Classics and related fields.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Classics – Classical Civilization
DeadlineDate: Early Action: November 1, 2025; Regular Decision: February 1, 2026
Requirements: To be considered for admission, first-year applicants will need to submit an online application, an $80 application fee, and an official high school transcript. Standardized test scores (SAT or ACT) are optional.
Department: College of Humanities & Earth and Social Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Classics provides students with a strong liberal arts education grounded in the languages, literatures, and cultures of ancient Greece and Rome. Students develop skills in critical thinking, analytical reasoning, and written and oral communication through the study of diverse texts and artifacts. In addition to a core of required courses, students choose either a concentration in Classical Civilization or Latin, each of which allows for significant flexibility in course selection based on individual interests. Graduates are prepared for a variety of careers in education, law, medicine, government, library science, and the arts, as well as for further study in graduate programs.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Classics – Greek, Latin, and Combined Greek and Latin
Department: The College of Liberal Arts & Sciences
Concentration: Greek, Latin, Combined Greek and Latin
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Classics with concentrations in Greek, Latin, or Combined Greek and Latin trains students in the languages, literatures, and cultures of ancient Greece and Rome. Through coursework in language, literature, ancient history, and classical civilization, students develop sophisticated skills in literary analysis, historical investigation, and comparative cultural analysis, as well as a rich understanding of the cultures that continue to shape Western civilization. By focusing on critical inquiry into ancient texts and cultures, the Classics Major fosters intellectual growth and provides excellent preparation for further study in a wide range of fields, from law to literature, archaeology to history, and theology to art history, as well as for careers in teaching, research, and public service. Graduates of the Classics Major also pursue careers in fields such as government, business, and journalism.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $182.46/credit hour (tuition only); Out-of-State: $798.04/credit hour (tuition only) (2023-2024)
CollegeApplicationFee: In-State: $7,674.86/year; Out-of-State: $22,448.86/year (2023-2024, includes tuition and fees)

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Communication Studies
Requirements: Students may declare a major in Communication Studies (COMM) when they are admitted to the University. To progress to upper-division courses (3000-level or higher), students must have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.0.
Description: Communication Studies is a dynamic and expanding academic discipline that explores the ways humans create and interpret messages. It is a vital field of study, particularly in an age of globalization and increasing dependence on mediated interactions. The mission of the Department of Communication Studies at UNC Charlotte is to provide students with a broad-based, liberal arts education that prepares them to be effective and ethical communicators in a diverse society. The Department provides students with a theoretically-grounded and practically-oriented understanding of human communication in interpersonal, organizational, cultural, and public contexts. Graduates are prepared for a variety of careers in business, government, non-profit organizations, and education. Many graduates also pursue advanced degrees in Communication, Law, Business, and other fields.
CostPerCredit: NC Resident: $304.08/credit hour; Non-NC Resident: $889.33/credit hour

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Computer Science degree provides students with a broad and flexible education in computer science, suitable for those interested in computing within an interdisciplinary context, or those seeking a more liberal arts-oriented approach to their computer science education. This degree is especially well-suited for students who plan to combine their computer science expertise with a minor or second major in another discipline. The curriculum offers a solid foundation in computer science theory and practice, with an emphasis on interdisciplinary applications and problem-solving skills. Students completing the B.A. degree are well-prepared for a variety of careers in computing and related fields, or for further study at the graduate level.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Data Science
Requirements: To apply for admission to UNC Charlotte as a first-year student, you must submit the following: A completed application for admission; A non-refundable $80 application fee; An official high school transcript; SAT or ACT scores (optional for 2024 applicants); A personal statement or essay (recommended for all applicants); Recommendation letters (optional).
Description: Data Science is an exciting, interdisciplinary field at the intersection of mathematics, statistics, and computer science. The Bachelor of Arts in Data Science degree is housed in the College of Computing and Informatics, but includes a broad array of courses in the College of Liberal Arts & Sciences, the Belk College of Business, and the College of Computing and Informatics. The curriculum is designed to educate students who want to develop strong analytical and quantitative skills that are essential in today’s data-driven world. Students will be trained to analyze, interpret, and communicate insights from complex data sets. These skills are highly sought after in various industries, including technology, finance, healthcare, and government. Through a combination of theoretical knowledge and hands-on experience, students will be prepared for a variety of entry-level positions in the growing field of data science or for graduate study.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Drama
Requirements: Students may declare a major in Theatre after they have been admitted to UNC Charlotte. Students are required to participate in an annual audition/interview for continuation in the B.A. or B.M. in Musical Theatre programs. Students are also required to meet for an annual academic advising review.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Drama program is designed to provide students with a broad and balanced education in theatre. Students study theatre history, literature, theory, and performance. The program prepares students for a variety of career paths in theatre, education, and related fields, or for graduate study.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Economics
Fees: In-State: $9,900.90/year; Out-of-State: $22,546.90/year (based on 2023-2024 rates, includes university fees and business undergrad program fee)
Description: Economics is about how societies deal with the problem of scarcity. All societies face the fundamental problem that human wants exceed the ability of resources to satisfy them. Economists examine how societies allocate their scarce resources to produce and distribute goods and services. A student pursuing an Economics B.S. degree will be introduced to a wide array of topics, including economic theory, econometrics, labor economics, public economics, international economics, industrial organization, money and banking, and economic history. Economics majors at UNC Charlotte learn to think critically and analytically about many complex economic and social issues. They are prepared for a diverse set of careers in both the private and public sectors as well as for graduate study in economics, business, or law. The Department of Economics is committed to academic excellence in both its undergraduate and graduate programs. Our faculty are active researchers, publishing in the top journals in their fields. This commitment to scholarship creates a dynamic and exciting learning environment for students. The Department is committed to providing its students with the analytical and quantitative skills that are essential for success in today’s demanding global economy.
CostPerCredit: In-State: ~$418.50 per credit hour; Out-of-State: ~$945.45 per credit hour (based on 2023-2024 part-time rates, excluding special fees)
CollegeApplicationFee: In-State: $9,900.90/year; Out-of-State: $22,546.90/year (based on 2023-2024 rates, includes university fees and business undergrad program fee)

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Education
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Elementary Education program prepares candidates to teach in kindergarten through sixth grade public school classrooms in North Carolina. The curriculum provides a strong foundation in liberal arts and sciences, in addition to professional studies courses designed to meet licensure requirements. A field experience component is required in each professional studies block. The program provides the knowledge and skills necessary to ensure effective teaching and learning for all students.
Accredidation: The Cato College of Education at UNC Charlotte is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) for a period of seven years, from Spring 2021 to Spring 2028. The Cato College of Education is also approved by the North Carolina State Board of Education for the preparation of teachers and other school personnel.
CostPerCredit: NC Resident: $182.17/credit hour, Non-NC Resident: $796.17/credit hour

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in English
Requirements: All first-year applicants must submit the following items to be considered for admission: A completed application (The Common App or the Future 49er Application), a non-refundable $80 application fee or fee waiver, and an official high school transcript. UNC Charlotte is test-optional for students applying for admission through Fall 2024. Your essay is an important part of your application.
Department: College of Humanities & Earth and Social Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in English provides students with an extensive introduction to the literary and cultural traditions of English, American, and other literatures in English. Through rigorous coursework, students hone skills in critical reading, analysis, and interpretation; develop sophisticated research abilities; and become articulate and persuasive writers. These skills are essential for successful careers in diverse fields such as law, education, publishing, journalism, technical writing, public relations, arts and nonprofit administration, and business. The English major also provides excellent preparation for graduate study in English and other humanities fields.
